txt.en: Talk to Ganburh
Talk to Elfswith
Talk to Gísling
Dudweld sighs heavily and wanders off
Ganburh slinks away, obviously embarrassed
Elfswith looks upset, but does not press the issue
Fastred wants you to distribute rations to the people of Snowbourn along with his guards.
Collected prepared rations for the people of Snowbourn ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'You have been a great help thus far, [placeholder]. If you would, I require your aid in handing out rations to the people of Snowbourn. Food has become scarce since you left for Walstow, and the people are getting restless.

'There is a cart of food in Snowbourn...keep an eye on it, then distribute food to people once you have established some sort of order.

'Thank you for your assistance. I will continue to make ready our battle plan.'

The food-cart is near the kitchen of Snowbourn.\n\nAs food is scarce, Fastred wants you to make sure that people wait and do not swarm the food-stores. Perhaps a stern <rgb=#FF00FF>ahem</rgb> will do.

'Oh, thank you so much!

'Reeve Fastred has been a more stern leader than Reeve Dagred, but I fear that this change has not been for the good of the people.

'My family and I have fallen on hard times, especially now that Snowbourn grows more crowded with people fleeing the Eastemnet.

'Thank you again, [placeholder].'
Prepared rations can be found inside the kitchen of Snowbourn.\n\nYou should collect rations for the people of Snowbourn.
Dudweld, Ganburh, and Elfswith can be found throughout Snowbourn.\n\nYou should distribute the food to Dudweld, Ganburh, and Elfswith.

'You did not have to be so abrupt before, but you have my thanks.

'I know not why Fastred has moved to establish such a strict order within Snowbourn. People continue to pour in, but he allows none of us to travel to the West where resources might be more abundant.

'Fastred has proven himself a worthy leader, but I am uncertain what the future holds for the Sutcrofts.'
Gísling can be found in central Snowbourn.\n\nYou should speak with Gísling and let him know you distributed the food as Fastred ordered.

'Thank you, [placeholder]...

'The crowds grow day after day... The Sutcrofts still provide a wealth of food to our people, but with more people coming here each day, I worry that we cannot sustain this.

'Fastred is a bold leader, but he must allow the people to journey west. We cannot support ourselves as the last sanctuary of the Eastemnet, not for long, anyway.'

'You did well in maintaining order. I am sure Fastred's guards were pleased that they could keep at watch instead of performing such a task.

'The concerns of those people are real, though. I worry that Snowbourn will not be able to support such a wealth of people for much longer.'

'Nevertheless, well done.'
Shoo Dudweld away from the food-stores with a stern <rgb=#FF00FF>ahem</rgb>
Shoo Ganburh away from the food-stores with a stern <rgb=#FF00FF>ahem</rgb>
Shoo Elfswith away from the food-stores with a stern <rgb=#FF00FF>ahem</rgb>
Collect prepared rations for the people of Snowbourn ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Cutting Back
Talk to Dudweld
